Math World

🧮 Advanced Problem 2

“Try to solve it using only elementary school knowledge!”

(1) There are 80 bills in total, consisting of 1,000 yen, 5,000 yen, and 10,000 yen bills. The number of 1,000 yen bills is equal to the number of 5,000 yen bills.

If the total value is 506,000 yen, how many 10,000 yen bills are there?

(2) You are hosting a party with 113 guests. There are three types of tables:

6-person tables 5-person tables 4-person tables You prepared a total of 23 tables, and all guests were seated with no empty seats.

The number of 6-person tables is equal to the number of 5-person tables.

📝 Hint

- Add the number of apples in each box.

- Simple addition!

💬 Comments / Alternative Solutions

Feel free to share your ideas or ask questions.
